meanings.definition: The speed of an aircraft relative to the air.
meanings.sent1: The airplane's airspeed was crucial for a safe flight.
meanings.sent2: Pilots always monitor the airspeed to ensure a smooth journey.
meanings.sent3: The comedic movie scene exaggerated the airspeed of a tiny toy plane.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement soared at an airspeed faster than a jet.
meanings.sent5: The airspeed of the fighter jet was breathtaking as it zoomed past.

meanings.definition: The rate at which an aircraft moves through the air.
meanings.sent1: A high airspeed is necessary for takeoff and landing.
meanings.sent2: The airspeed indicator helps pilots maintain a steady pace.
meanings.sent3: The airspeed of the paper airplane surprised everyone in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down as the airspeed increased during the flight.
meanings.sent5: The airspeed of the glider allowed for a peaceful journey through the clouds.
